definition: to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Not forget that the wall of the room a few obtrusive calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 忘不了房間牆壁上那幾個礙眼的毛筆字。

sentences.english: That pile of trash is an eyesore. ;
The new office block is an excrescence on the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 這座新辦公樓在這片風景中很礙眼。

sentences.english: These gaudy signs all over campus are a real eyesore.
sentences.chinese: 這些花花綠綠的標牌立在校園裏，怪礙眼的。

sentences.english: Garbage before the door is in the way.
sentences.chinese: 門前那堆垃圾實在太礙眼了。

sentences.english: The broken window was an eye-sore to the neighbors .
sentences.chinese: 鄰居們覺得那扇破窗很礙眼。

sentences.english: See what people are unsightly, not just eye fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 看什麼都礙眼的人，疲勞的不僅僅是眼睛。

sentences.english: Earplugs turned the picture to black-and-white.
sentences.chinese: 耳機礙眼得就像把一出精彩的演出變成黑白的了。

definition: (usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4
